result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucky Lee Briggs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Fine of $1,200.00 plus all mandatory costs, penalties and $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  To be paid out of up to 25% of prison funds and wages.  Any balance as a condition of ES.  if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant does qualify for Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving one (1) year  Initial Confinement in this case.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment to the extent possible.
Mental health assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.  No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community or with the victim Alicia J.
Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.
To commence upon eligibility to reinstate license.
Court ordered AODA assessment and Driver's Safety Plan.  To cooperate with any treatment recommended.

Submit a  DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

Defendant Lucky Lee Briggs in court with attorney Jodi Andrea Sanfelippo.  Defendant Lucky Lee Briggs in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 4 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 123 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
  
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victim Alicia J.
*Seek and maintain full time employment to the extent possible.
*Anger management.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is ordered in the amount of $338.00 to be paid to Alicia J.

Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $1,200.00 plus all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges, and $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge.   Court ordered AODA assessment and Driver's Safety Plan.  Defendant to cooperate with any treatment recommended.  Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for a period of 2 years.    Court orders defendant restricted to operation of vehicles equipped with an ignition interlock device for 1 year to commence upon eligibility to reinstate license.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, surcharges, fine, restitution, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program but does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year initial confinement in this case.


Appeal rights given.   
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Lucky Lee Briggs in court with attorney Jodi Andrea Sanfelippo.  Defendant Lucky Lee Briggs in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for final pretrial conference.  Defendant would like to enter a projected guilty plea.  Pursuant to plea negotiations, the state is going to read in an uncharged incident #152070127 from July 7, 2015.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
Case entered in error on September 15, 2015 at 8:30 am.  Parties had September 16, 2015 at 8:30 am.  Case remains calendared for final pretrial on October 5, 2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 26.
WCS Discharge letter due to being in custody as of 7/28/15 received and filed.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Lucky Lee Briggs in court with attorney Jodi Andrea Sanfelippo.  Defendant Lucky Lee Briggs in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court grants state's motion to adjourn jury trial.  Parties informed the court, case may resolve.  Court ordered case be calendared for three dates, a status/projected guilty plea, final pretrial conference and jury trial.   Case is adjourned for Status conference/projected guilty plea, Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, Branch 26.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Notice of Motion and Motion to Adjourn filed.

Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defendant would like to be heard as to bail.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.

Defendant Lucky Lee Briggs in court with attorney Jodi Andrea Sanfelippo.  Defendant Lucky Lee Briggs in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds the following:
*  In order to provide the Defendant with a competent attorney in a case of this nature with penalties of kind faced by this Defendant, the Court must pay a fee hight than the $40.00 per hour base fee authorized by the Chief Judge.
*  The Defendant agrees to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expenses paid by Milwaukee County.
IT IS ORDERED:
*  Attorney Jodi Sanfelippo shall be the appointing attorney at County Expense shall be paid at the rate of $60.00/hour excluding travel and $25/hour for travel exceeding 30 miles.
*  Defendant is required to reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $100.00 commencing on 03-10-2015 and on the 10th of every month during the pendency of the case.
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense received, signed and filed with court.   

Scheduling conference scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lucky Lee Briggs in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA St. Junior).    Court conducted indigency hearing and appointed Atty. Jodi Sanfelippo to represent defendant at County expense.  Status conference scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lucky Lee Briggs in court, in custody.  Ron Dague for Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant appears without counsel.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.   Court suspends the proceedings and orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Same Bail.  
  Indigency hearing scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by portable breathalyzers. Defendant to be monitored by SCRAM.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Natalie W.

Defendant Lucky Lee Briggs in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Lucky Lee Briggs in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Commissioner enter a plea of NOT GUILTY to count 2 on the defendant's behalf. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
